plugins.name: Connect
plugins.description:
Mirror any screen to any file and create global userflows without duplicating your content. Update them whenever you want.


Use cases


1. Put together multiple screens from different files into a single one without duplicating your content. Screens get imported as images so they are not directly editable. This allows you to keep your source files organized and create global flows to present to PMs, POs, Stakeholders, etc. Screens keep connected by their Artboard name so you can update them whenever you need if there are any changes to the source files.


2. If creating device mockups you can mirror your screens to import images from your screens quickly without manually copy pasting them.


How to use


1. Create a new file where you want to import all of your files.

2. Generate an access token from your Settings page under your profile name.

3. Copy the generated token.

4. Open the Connect plugin and paste your token.

5. You can now paste any file link you want to import.

6. Select the screens you want to import. You can search through them, or filter by pages.

7. Hit 'Connect Selected' and that's it!


You can now use arrow plugins to connect your screens if you need to create a flow. If you make any changes to the original screens just import your file again and select the screens you want to overwrite. Keep in mind you need to name your artboards accordingly.


Creating Connect

Follow updates

plugins.name: Cleaner
plugins.description:
Cleaner works within the selection or on the current page.


Features

  1. Remove unused properties
  2. Remove unused layers
  3. Remove hidden components (and instances)
  4. Remove auto-layout
  5. Remove guides
  6. Ungroup single-layer groups
  7. Rename layers
  8. Skip locked layers
  9. List and remove unused styles
  10. Auto-save last settings


------------------------------------------


Remove unused properties

  1. Any fill, stroke, effect, and grid that has visibility set to "hidden" will be deleted.
  2. This will also remove the fills that do not affect on resultant color.


Remove unused layers

  1. Any layer that has visibility set to "hidden" will be deleted.
  2. This will also remove empty layers. Layers with interactions will be ignored.


Remove hidden components

  1. Any component or instance that has visibility set to "hidden" will be deleted.


Ungroup single-layer groups

  1. Any group that has only one child will be ungrouped.
  2. Groups with blend modes, effects, interactions, or export settings will be ignored.


Rename layers

  1. Non-descriptive layer names, such as "Rectangle 12 copy" will be renamed.
  2. Text layer names will be replaced with their content.
  3. Components, instances, and layers with export settings will be ignored.


Remove auto-layout

  1. This will remove "auto-layout" from single-element frames.


Remove guides

  1. Remove guides within the selection or on the current page.


Skip locked layers

  1. Locked layers will be ignored.


List unused styles in the document

  1. Unused styles will be listed in the 'Styles' tab with their names and types.


Feel free to give any feedback and request.


Support me: Buy me a coffee

plugins.name: AD Compressor
plugins.description:
If you are designing and developing Google static banner ads, you must make sure all the image file sizes meet the â‰¤150kB specification.


With AD Compressor, you can compress multiple display banner ads with a click. The plugin is completely FREE for use as long as your compression usage is available.


HOW TO USE


1. Install `AD Compressor` and run it inside of a project

2. Enter and verify your Tinify API(require for the first time â€” browser, application or machine)

3. Select frames or objects you want to compress(by default, ONLY the existing & visible FRAME(s) would be automatically selected.)

4. When all the frames are ready, you can hit `COMPRESS` button to compress all images are over 150kB(default)

5. OPTIONAL: if you would like to give a nice formatted prefix for each image, you can use the `OUTPUT PREFIX` input field

6. Once the compression is done, you can `DOWNLOAD` all the final outputs within a ZIP


NOTES


- This plugin would only compress if the image is over than the compression setting(default 150kB), any file sizes are lower than this setting would not run compression(The idea is to make the image size smaller but keep the best quality).


- By default, ONLY the existing FRAME(s) would be automatically selected. If you want to compress anything that is not within a frame, you would need to select individually or select multiples at one time.


- Recently, the plugin has integrated with a free server-side compression(Tinify API â€” TinyPNG) which could provide a better image quality.


- All Responsive ADs(sizes are up to 5 MB) or images are over to 5 MB would skip compressing


Built with love by the Â©SearchKings team.
plugins.tagline: Made it spespecially for Google Display Ads

plugins.name: Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
With the 2023config conference releasing more convenient variations, I created this plugin to help you quickly convert local color styles into variables and keep the original name and structure.


After conversion, you can change from calling styles to calling variables and delete previously converted styles


â€œEdit your existing color styles to use a variable instead of a hex code for an easier transition to using variables with components.â€--Figma


Attentionï¼š

  1. Not all styles can be converted, currently only single, solid fills can.
  2. Styles with multiple layers of padding, gradients, images, and video are not converted, so do not remove them after conversion. This is because the variable function of Figma does not support these
  3. Of course, text styles, effects, and grid styles are not supported


Thank you for using this plugin. Have a nice day at work

plugins.name: Heron variable tools
plugins.description:
Heron variable tools can help you manage variables efficiently.


Learn more here:

ðŸ‘‰ðŸ» https://heronhq.com/variable-tools


ðŸŽ‰ Now you can import or update palette variables from https://huetone.ardov.me


Fix raw values as variables

Set rules like using "Spacing/anyName" variables for auto-layout padding, click "Fix Variables", and it'll auto-bind all unbound values - works for text & effect styles too. Try it out! âœ¨


Import variables from libraries

Import variables from your favorite libraries so you can create your theme based on these palettes. For now we support Tailwindcss, Chakra UI, Radix UI, MUI and Ant design.


Import and export design token format module

Import and export variables by JSON file, based on the Design Token Format Module. You can copy variables from one file to another.


Bulk editing variables' scoping

Select variables, then edit their color scoping, number scoping or if hiding from publishing. This will save lots of time for you.


Bulk editing code syntax by convention

You can select a naming convention and apply it to multiple variables. Heron variable tools will add code syntax for every variable based on the naming convention and their name. Now we support 7 types of convention.

  1. CSS variable: var(--text-color)
  2. SASS variable: $text-color
  3. LESS variable: @text-color
  4. Upper camel case: TextColor
  5. Lower camel case: textColor
  6. Upper snake case: TEXT_COLOR
  7. Lower snake case: text_color


Bulk renaming variables

Bulk renaming variables' name or changing naming style.


Generate color guide

Generate color guide from your local color variables automatically.


Create/Update variables from guide

Create or update color variables from your color guide. Manage color values and descriptions in Figma canvas.


Copy and paste variables

Copy variables, paste them in another collection or file.


Swap styles to variables

Swap your old styles to new variables with the same name. Support ignoring style prefix.

accepted.name: Hal Lee
accepted.description: keep curious. https://heronhq.com

plugins.name: Formplay
plugins.description:
Formplay is a figma plugin that connects code and design systems.Drag-and-drop building, efficient design,efficient development.


Formplay for Designer

Formplay offers a wide range of form design components, allowing designers to easily build forms for various scenarios through drag-and-drop functionality. With just one click, Formplay generates Figma form UI.


Formplay for Developer

Based on Formilyjs, a form design tool that connects code and design systems.efficient Development.

Using formplay, you can get code directly from the designerâ€™s figma file that can be used in a production environment.


Get support anytime

Have any questions or rendering issues? Please leave a comment in the comment section.

plugins.name: CSS Exporter
plugins.description:
The CSS Exporter is a simple and fast CSS export tool. It can export Local styles and Local variables to a CSS file based on your presets.


Features:

  1. Set Token prefix
  2. Customize Separator
  3. Customize unit, px or rem
  4. Customize color type, hex, rgb, rgba, hsl
  5. Customize export format, css, tailwind, json


The CSS Exporter does not export SCSS, LESS, or other syntaxes. This is because the exported format is CSS variable format, which is applicable to various CSS preprocessor languages. If you need it to export SCSS, LESS, or other formats, please let me know.


If this plugin is helpful to you, remember to come back to this page and give me a "Like". â¤ï¸

plugins.name: CI HUB Connector
plugins.description:
Stay creative, stay in Figma!


Add images/text to your designs directly from wherever they are, directly in Figma.


Access Stock Images or use your workflow for approval, directly in Figma


Share with your Team in Dropbox, Box, Google Drive and more.


Already supported: Adobe CC Library, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Stock, Adstream, Aprimo, Box, Brandfolder, Brandmaster, Brandworkz, Bynder, Celum, Censhare, Cliplister, Dash, Dropbox, Eyebase, Fadel, Fotoware, Gelato, Getty Images, Google Drive, Google Photos, Imageshop, Istock, Keepeek, Myview, OneDrive, Opentext, Picturepark, Pimcore, Pixelboxx, Purered, Sharedien, Sharepoint, Shutterstock, SiteFusion, Unsplash, Veeva, Webdam, WIden, Workfront


Created with â¤ï¸ by CI HUB


STEP 1: Install the Plugin


STEP 2: Setup your CI HUB ID at https://ci-hub.com


STEP 3: Connect to where your Files are and start using.


Repeat STEP 3 for every system you need to connect.


CI HUB is the ultimate solution for connecting your digital supply chain and almost like a productivity cheat code for designers, marketing departments and sales teams.


This is a cheat code that should be shared with your fellow designers and creators, the CI HUB Connector is available for the Adobe suite, Microsoft, Google Workspace and so much more.

Save your team time and recommend the CI HUB connector to a friend today.


Learn how to save time in Figma, visit our Acadamey for tips and tricks: https://ci-hub.com/academy/


Receive a 30-day free trial just register to create a CI HUB ID.


Payment via credit card is required upon the conclusion of the trial period to continue use. VISIT https://ci-hub.com for all the latest pricing and details. Corporate plans are available on request at sales@ci-hub.com.


To use the CI HUB Connector to connect to one of the offered third party systems, you may need a login/user account with the selected system. The availability and/or the right to connect to the third-party system is not part of the CI HUB Connector or the CI HUB Services. To use the third-party system, there may be additional cost and/or agreements with the provider of the third-party system needed. CI HUB reserves the right to remove the third-party system from the list of avail. systems or add new third party systems at any time and without notice. To use CI HUB Connector, a full connection to the Internet is required at all times. (Corporate setups with Proxy or Firewalls on request)


To see Demo-Videos, Tutorials and more go to https://ci-hub.com/academy/ or visit our Youtube Channel.


We are always here to help you! Let us know any issue, suggestion or feedback: support@ci-hub.com

Version 1.2.48 
Today, we released the "Link" function for Figma. And we added the Replace and Replace all feature. 
"Link": 
The link panel allows you to check your Dropbox, Box.com, Google Drive, and all other Systems if the Images are newer than the ones in your Figma. This is the easiest way to ensure your design is consistent or update the design with the latest images. 

"Replace/Replace all":
Imagine you have a design and use some images in multiple places. And now you need to replace it because there is a newer version. Did it take it more than 10 seconds to fix this? Now, this is the time it takes. That's it. 

Try it.

Bulk Copy Text

Bulk Paste Text

Paste the contents of the clipboard onto the selected text layers.


Copy for Spreadsheet

Copy the text within the selected text layers to the clipboard, formatted for pasting into a spreadsheet.

Find and replace text in text layers within the selection or on the current page.

Normalize Text Style

plugins.name: Hey Figma Speech Recognition
plugins.description:
Let you insert a text from your voice using speech recognition. Click Open Voice > Start Speaking to start the speech recognition. Once finished, it will automagically add text into the plugin. Click add text to add it on the canvas.

How it works:

- It will open a new browser window, because Figma doesn't have permission for microphone.
- The web app will recognize your voice locally in your browser using webkit SpeechRecognition, so you need to use modern browser
- Lastly, it will send the text result back to the plugin via web socket

Supported language: English

accepted.name: Sonny Lazuardi
accepted.description: Building design plugins, prototypes, and apps

33114.description:

How it works:

- The web app will recognize your voice locally in your browser using webkit SpeechRecognition, so you need to use modern browser
- Lastly, it will send the text result back to the plugin via web socket

Supported language: English

plugins.name: Componentizer
plugins.description:
Magically turn frames into components.


Clean up those messy design files with a single click. Componentizer automatically matches similar layers and converts them to components for you. Here's how it works:


Finds Matching Frames

Automatically runs through your entire document to find frames matching your selection. Or have it process every frame in the document.


Creates and Swaps for Component Instances

Creates a component and swaps out all matching frames for instances of it.


Applies Overrides

Reduces the number of components needed by finding those that could be recreated by applying overrides to similar components.


Learn more at http://componentizer.design.

  • Label the styles with a unique custom color name imported from the list of colors in Coolors.co.
  • Label them in the [Color Name]/[Tone] format if you have multiple shades of a color. Just Select all your shades and enter the Color Name(Primary, Secondary, Neutral etc. ) The plugin automatically detects the tone of each color and applies it accordingly.

plugins.name: LCH
plugins.description:
This simple color picker allows you to use the LCH color space in your designs with ease. The LCH color space is perceptually uniform and significantly simplifies creating and modifying color systems. If you'd like to find out more, check out this great article!


Features

  • Pick colors by adjusting lightness, chroma, hue and alpha levels;
  • Use it in your designs for fills, strokes and gradients;
  • Adjust colors of multiple objects simultaneously using Ctrl (âŒ˜) and Shift keys;
  • Import/export colors from/to hex, rgb() and lch() CSS strings.


Feedback and troubleshooting

Source code is available at GitHub.


If you have any suggestions or encounter any bugs, feel free to message me at zisest@gmail.com.


Acknowledgements

This plugin was inspired by Lea Verou's color picker available at css.land/lch/.


Conversion logic is by Chris Lilley.

plugins.name: Easy Barcode
plugins.description:
Easy Barcode - Simplify Barcode Generation in Figma


Unlock the power of effortless barcode creation with the "Easy Barcode" Figma plugin. Designed to streamline your workflow, this plugin seamlessly integrates the JsBarcode library to generate and insert barcodes directly into your Figma designs.

Enjoying my free Figma plugin? â˜• Consider buying me a coffee to fuel future development!


Key Features:


  • Intuitive Interface: The plugin offers a user-friendly interface, making barcode generation a breeze for both beginners and experienced designers.


  • JsBarcode Integration: Built on the reliable JsBarcode library, Easy Barcode ensures high-quality and accurate barcode rendering for various types, including Code128, EAN-13, UPC-A, and more.


  • Customization Options: Tailor your barcodes to suit your design needs. Adjust the size, color, and other parameters easily within the plugin, ensuring a perfect fit for your Figma project.


  • Real-time Preview: Visualize your barcode in real-time as you customize it, allowing you to fine-tune the details and see the changes instantly.


  • Insert Directly into Figma: Say goodbye to manual imports. Easy Barcode seamlessly inserts generated barcodes directly into your Figma canvas, saving you time and effort.


Versatile Use Cases: Whether you're designing product packaging, inventory systems, or event tickets, Easy Barcode is the go-to solution for incorporating barcodes into your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Generator
plugins.description:
Generator

Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you quickly generate multiple designs with changing data, such as certificates with different names or business cards with different contact information.


Definitions

  • CSV headers: The top row of a CSV file, which contains the names of the data fields.
  • Variables: Text layers or certain text within a text layer that are linked to CSV headers.


Conventions

  • Global variables: Use the '#' symbol to indicate a global variable. For example, to use the 'Email' header as a global variable, name a layer '#Email' (Syntax: #VariableName)
  • Inline variables: Use curly braces ('{}') to indicate an inline variable. For example, to use the 'Email' header as an inline variable, include '#{Email}' within the text of a text layer. (Syntax: #{VariableName})


How to Use

  1. Select a design frame and a text layer containing the CSV data you want to use. You can also use the file upload option to upload a local CSV file. Click next once youâ€™re done
  2. Select the variables you want to include in your design from the available selection chips.
  3. (Optional) Enable inline variables to replace specific parts of a text layer rather than the whole. Avoid enabling it when unnecessary as it is a time-heavy operation.
  4. Click 'Generate' to create the new frames with the specified text.


Tips

  • Make sure to rename your layers or layer content according to the conventions mentioned above to use variables from the CSV data.
  • Feel free to check out our regularly-updated docs: https://rebrand.ly/generatordocs
  • If you have any further questions or need assistance, join our discord server or our telegram community.


Got more ideas?

Got any features you'd like to have us implement? Send them our way here

plugins.name: Figma to Readymag
plugins.description:
Speed-transfer your layouts to Readymag

The Figma to Readymag plugin imports a page layout or its separate elements into a Readymag project. It saves you time and effort when moving anything created in Figma into Readymag. The plugin doesnâ€™t create the ready-to-go website but only transfers the composition so you can elaborate it further.


How to use the plugin

  1. Open the plugin in your Figma project.
  2. Select any number of elements or a single-page layout. Click â€œPrepare for copyingâ€ and wait for the process to finish. It may take a few seconds.
  3. Then, click the â€œCopy to clipboardâ€ button. Wait a bit until your elements or a layout is copied.
  4. Go to your Readymag project and paste the content. If you want to paste one or several copied elements, press âŒ˜/Ctrl+V. If youâ€™ve copied the Full page layout and want your Readymag page parameters to adapt to your Figma ones, press âŒ˜/Ctrl+Shift+V.
  5. Wait until the pasting is finished.


Note: The plugin moves Figma elements to Readymagâ€™s Editor using just three widgets: Text, Shape, and Picture. Such functionality saves elementsâ€™ visual characteristics but doesnâ€™t add interactivity to themâ€”youâ€™ll need to manually add interactive features, such as links, buttons, and animations afterward.

We made sure to pick the most corresponding substitutes for the unique Figma elements: in cases where some technical abilities in Figma and Readymag donâ€™t match, youâ€™ll get the option closest to your initial idea.


Workflow tips

Here are a few tips thatâ€™ll help you use the plugin with maximum vantage:

  1. To get everything imported smoothly, make sure your Readymag project has the fonts used in the Figma layout. You can add fonts to a project from Readymagâ€™s font library or upload fonts that arenâ€™t in the library directly in the project.
  2. Transfer to the desktop version of your project. Readymag follows desktop-first logic, which means that the desktop version is the primary one and the mobile version is created from the desktop one. You can paste your elements into the mobile version, but theyâ€™ll be hidden by default on the desktop one.
  3. Make sure each of your elements is within 9999px in width and height. The plugin can only transfer elements in this range. If a Figma element is bigger, it wonâ€™t appear in your Readymag layout.
  4. Use it to import graphics. The plugin makes it easy to import graphic elements, such as icons, directly and in 2 clicks.


What Readymag is

Itâ€™s a design tool that helps create interactive websites, editorials, portfolios, and landing pages without coding. It offers advanced animations, a massive library of free fonts, and teamwork features, and empowers everyone to meet their goals for online representation while maintaining complete creative freedom.

plugins.name: Status Changer
plugins.description:
Status Changer allows you to easily change the name of the person in charge and the modified date on your own Component set.


HOW TO USE

  1. Install `Status Changer` and run it inside of a project.
  2. Edit the Component Set created for the Status bar.(Note whether the item has been added to Variants.)
  3. Select the Frames, etc. to which you want to add a status bar and run Status Changer.
  4. You can select your own customized component set values, and the status bar(s) will be added when you select and press the SET button.
  5. After changing the status, click "Change user name and modification time." from the plugin in the properties screen on the right.


About Dates and Dates

Multiple country formats are supported, including American and British, Asian, etc.


Sample For January 2, 2022 at 11:03 p.m.


For the British "DD/MM/YY H.mm a" 02/01/22 11.03 pm

For the U.S. "MM-DD-YY H:mm a" 01-02-22 11:03 pm

For the Japan "YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm" 2022/01/02 23:03

Click Here For More Info! 


Caution

Be sure to place it directly below the page.

Do not rename the properties.

plugins.name: Rename and Organize Frames
plugins.description:
The plugin simplifies the process of bulk renaming and sorting frames in Figma. Designed with UX/UI designers in mind, it offers two main features:



Bulk Renaming: Select multiple frames and rename them based on their position on the canvas. You can choose to sort by X or Y position, making it easy to organize your frames in a logical order.


Reorder frames: Automatically arrange selected frames in a row or column with a customizable spacing. This feature ensures your frames are perfectly aligned and spaced, enhancing your design workflow.


How to Use:

  1. Select the frames you want to rename or sort.
  2. Open the plugin and choose whether to rename by X or Y position.
  3. Alternatively, use the auto layout feature to arrange your frames with the desired spacing.


Limitations:

The plugin works only with frame selections. Ensure all selected items are frames for optimal performance.

It does not support other types of nodes like groups, components, or vectors.


Streamline your Figma workflow with our easy-to-use plugin, designed to save you time and effort.
plugins.tagline: Effortless bulk renaming and organized frame sorting

plugins.name: Swap Variables
plugins.description:
ÐÐ° Ñ€ÑƒÑÑÐºÐ¾Ð¼ â€” Ð½Ð¸Ð¶Ðµ.


How to use

Run it from the Quick Actions or Plugin menu.

Select some layers, choose source and destination variable collections and hit Swap button.


You can choose the scope for plugin: selection, current page, all pages or local styles.


After all, you may see some error. Click on them to focus viewport on problematic objects.


How it works

Swap Variables will display all local and enabled external variable collections that actually contains variables.


When you swap these collections, plugin will recursively find every used variable, then check two things:

  1. variable exists in source collection,
  2. destination collection containt variable with same group and name.


After the plugin ends its job, it will display known ecnountered errors below Swap button.


Known limitations

  1. If you modified external libraries, reload file to apply changes.
  2. Plugin doesn't swap styles. Use Swap Libraries instead.
  3. Plugin can't swap strokes in section. Thatâ€™s not supported by Figma API yet. Do it manually instead.
  4. It may take some time to parse and swap variables when there're to many nodes or variables. Take a break and make some tea.
  5. Scoped variables was not tested.


Possible features

  1. â˜‘ï¸ Clickable error allows to zoom in problematic layers.
  2. â˜‘ï¸ Collections with 0 variables are hidden.
  3. â˜‘ï¸ Typographic variables.
  4. â˜‘ï¸ Rebinding modes if the share the same name.
  5. â˜‘ï¸ Swapping variables in local styles.
  6. â˜‘ï¸ Gradients support.
  7. ðŸ”² Display number of variables in collection.
  8. ðŸ”² Selecting the option that's in second select makes them swap.


Problem? Idea? Kind words?

I accept feature suggestions and ideas to improve the plugin. No need to mess with hidden layers? Useful exceptions? If you have any ideas or issues, let me know in the comments.


Alternatively you can contact me via e-mail at nikita.denisov@vk.team and Telegram.

138173.name: Swap Variables
138173.description:
ÐÐ° Ñ€ÑƒÑÑÐºÐ¾Ð¼ â€” Ð½Ð¸Ð¶Ðµ.


How to use

Run it from the Quick Actions or Plugin menu.

Select some layers, choose source and destination variable collections and hit Swap button.


You can choose the scope for plugin: selection, current page, all pages or local styles.


After all, you may see some error. Click on them to focus viewport on problematic objects.


How it works

Swap Variables will display all local and enabled external variable collections that actually contains variables.


When you swap these collections, plugin will recursively find every used variable, then check two things:

  1. variable exists in source collection,
  2. destination collection containt variable with same group and name.


After the plugin ends its job, it will display known ecnountered errors below Swap button.


Known limitations

  1. If you modified external libraries, reload file to apply changes.
  2. Plugin doesn't swap styles. Use Swap Libraries instead.
  3. Plugin can't swap strokes in section. Thatâ€™s not supported by Figma API yet. Do it manually instead.
  4. It may take some time to parse and swap variables when there're to many nodes or variables. Take a break and make some tea.
  5. Scoped variables was not tested.


Possible features

  1. â˜‘ï¸ Clickable error allows to zoom in problematic layers.
  2. â˜‘ï¸ Collections with 0 variables are hidden.
  3. â˜‘ï¸ Typographic variables.
  4. â˜‘ï¸ Rebinding modes if the share the same name.
  5. â˜‘ï¸ Swapping variables in local styles.
  6. â˜‘ï¸ Gradients support.
  7. ðŸ”² Display number of variables in collection.
  8. ðŸ”² Selecting the option that's in second select makes them swap.


Problem? Idea? Kind words?

I accept feature suggestions and ideas to improve the plugin. No need to mess with hidden layers? Useful exceptions? If you have any ideas or issues, let me know in the comments.


Alternatively you can contact me via e-mail at nikita.denisov@vk.team and Telegram.
